posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Ravenloft is lvl 20 roleplay server with a gothic horror setting. They have a custom system where you get more feats than usual, and some of the skills are changed. Eg. Parry gives an AC bonus comparable to tumble under certain circumstances.
The setting is low magic. Some crafted items are good, but it takes a lot of effort to aquire enough crafting skill.
I think I have a rogue/ranger character there that I played to lvl 7 a couple of years ago. But I find it hard to give advice since I don't know how it is to play at higher levels there.
If I should start a new character there and choose a power class, I would take paladin for melee, or cleric if I was in the mood to rp one.
I believe that strength based is better than dex based there.
Since levelling is slow, it becomes important to have a character that is ok to play at all levels.

posts.content: question: how much do sneaks outweight ? i was looking at doing like a rogue 4/wiz6 and then aa for the rest ? that compared with Mick's barb3/wiz8/aa9 where you get a higher hp count and speed?

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Your Hide skill is opposed by their Spot skill, and your Move Silently skill is opposed by their Listen skill. This article and the ones it links should help: http://nwn.wikia.com/wiki/Stealth
More Wizard would mean a lower AB and fewer Rogue skill dumps.
